treatment.etymology: [Saxon, Osmunder, name for Thor, god of war]
treatment.description: Plants terrestrial. Stems creeping; tips often somewhat erect. Leaves dimorphic; fertile leaves erect, often notably smaller than sterile leaves in length and width. Blades 1--2-pinnate; pinnae monomorphic to dimorphic, pinnatifid or pinnate.
treatment.author: R. David Whetstone
T. A. Atkinson

key_statement.statement: Fertile leaves with pinnae monomorphic, all spore-bearing; tuft of hairs persistent on abaxial surface of pinnae near base.
Fertile leaves with pinnae dimorphic, some spore-bearing, some not; tuft of hairs absent on abaxial surface of pinnae near base.
Sterile leaves pinnate-pinnatifid or 2-pinnate with pinnules stalked.
Fertile pinnae medial, sterile leaves pinnate-pinnatifid.
